page.title: 05Village life-Baston.
page.content: The village of Baston used to have 5 {public houses}but now has only 2. There is a rhyme incorporating the names of the five: 'The Black Horse kicked the White Horse And made the Red Lion roar. The Millstone threshed the Wheat Sheaf And ground it on the floor.' Many of the old village trades have gone - wheelwrights,carpenters etc. but there are still one or two new houses being built bringing craftsmen into the village for this work. The larger public house has grown larger and caters for people from much farther afield. Many of the villagers now{commute}to the larger towns to work instead of being mainly orientated towards{agriculture} although this influence still exists.
